doc:
Michael Stroka https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Michael_Stroka 0 Michael George Stroka (May 9, 1938 in Passaic, New Jersey – April 14, 1997) was an American actor on soap operas including ABC-TV's cult supernatural show Dark Shadows, in which he played Aristede, Bruno Hess, and Laszlo Ferrari from 1969 to 1970. In addition, he made a cameo appearance as a pallbearer in MGM's House of Dark Shadows (1970), the first of two feature films based on the hit TV series. Stroka was the son of Slovak immigrants, and was born in Passaic, New Jersey. Stroka was Byzantine Catholic, and a member of Saint Mary's Byzantine cathedral in Sherman Oaks. From 1975 to 1976, he appeared as Dr. Quentin Henderson on The Edge of Night. He also guest-starred in the Buck Rogers in the 25th Century episode "Journey to Oasis". Michael Stroka died from kidney cancer in Los Angeles, California at age 58. Michael_George_Stroka ( May_9_,_1938 in Passaic , New_Jersey – April_14_,_1997 ) was an_American_actor on soap_operas including ABC-TV 's_cult_supernatural_show_Dark_Shadows , in which he played Aristede , Bruno_Hess , and Laszlo_Ferrari from 1969 to 1970 . In addition , he made a_cameo_appearance as a_pallbearer in MGM 's_House of Dark_Shadows ( 1970_) , the_first of two_feature_films based on the_hit_TV_series . Stroka was the_son of Slovak_immigrants , and was_born in Passaic , New_Jersey . Stroka was Byzantine_Catholic , and a_member of Saint_Mary 's_Byzantine_cathedral in Sherman_Oaks . From 1975 to 1976 , he appeared as Dr._Quentin_Henderson on The_Edge of Night . He also guest-starred in the_Buck_Rogers in the_25th_Century_episode_"_Journey to Oasis_" . Michael_Stroka died from kidney_cancer in Los_Angeles , California at age_58 .
